Reviews.Title: “Nice new lobby, older rooms”
Reviews.Author: gjscraftygirl
Reviews.Content: Visited in February 2012, when flying into Baltimore. Marriott right at the airport and just a quick 3 minute drive from the terminal. First glance at the property and you wonder if the property has been updated as the building is older. The lobby is updated nicely, but the rooms need some updating. Was surprised to find the old-styled tube TVs in the rooms, rather than the newer flat screens, and while not every hotel has updated their electronics, this was after all a full-service Marriott. We stay at Marriott properties a lot, and found this one to be lacking and in need of updating. There is really no food within walking distance, so be prepared with a rental car or to eat in the hotel restaurant. If in Baltimore, I may stay here again, but I'm not entirely certain. Marriott - this is another hotel that needs an update! Lobbies are nice, but that isn't where the guests stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: dieselfiend
Reviews.Content: The hotel needs some serious updating. It got the job done but definitely not what I was expecting for a Marriott. Still using beat up tube TV's and everything seemed out of date except for the front desk and outside. The WIFI was free but instructions were cleverly buried beneath the higher speed WIFI ads that lead you to believe it's not free. I fell for it and ordered the $12 WIFI because I really needed an internet connection. Bottom line: The hotel isn't worth over $100 per night. Here are way better hotels for a lot less money in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not near anything”
Reviews.Author: jsosso
Reviews.Content: I do hope you drove here. Otherwise there is nothing in walking distance. Besides the location the rooms are nice and the staff was was helpful when confronted, otherwise they seem to busy to notice you. Also bring your large wallet for the hotel bar. We were going to have dinner and drinks but found out what our first two drinks cost payed our bill and had room service for dinner and breakfast the next day. Its a sad day when Hotel room service is cheaper then the menu at a sports bar attached to a Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quite, good value”
Reviews.Author: WalterBTV
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean, new lobby, staff is somewhat friendly, rooms are clean however dated. Have to pay for wi fi in room, or free in lobby. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Company business”
Reviews.Author: KC10Extender
Reviews.Content: Excellent close to a great business trip. Beautiful entry and atrium. Nothing less than the best in the room. Staff was excellent in the late arrival and getting me off to my room in less than 5 minutes. Perfect service to and from the airport for departure.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service, but lacks attention to room detail.”
Reviews.Author: Rob P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to the BWI airport and shuttle service to and from the airport is provided. There are a lot of hotels on the same road and it would be interesting to see how they compare. The rate of this hotel is $199 per night. Since this hotel is so close to the airport there is a lot of airplane noise, so don't plan on getting a good night sleep. The rooms also have thin metal doors which adjoin other rooms. If the person/family next to your room is loud, then this noise will funnel into your room. The amenities have been updated to contain a flat panel TV, more comfortable bed, and a newer radio/alarm clock. The areas that need updating is sound insulation, bathroom and standard room maintenance. The shower faucet handle seemed to be set in sand since it did not move smoothly and the shower drain had seen better days. The track to the closet door was loose causing the door to jam when opening or closing. Most hotels offer free internet access, but for some reason this hotel still charges $12.95 a day. The reason why I picked this hotel was the large exercise facility which also contained free weights and the general location to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding event facility”
Reviews.Author: cw413
Reviews.Content: I have been the project manager for several conventions hosted at the BWI Marriott. Their event staff work very hard to keep the guests happy. Meeting space is self contained in one wing, which makes it convenient for attendees to find their destination. Close proximity to train station and airport makes it the most convenient of airport convention venue.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect pre-flight option”
Reviews.Author: Nashna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Baltimore Marriott prior to an early morning Apple Charter flight. We did the park and fly option which just added $30.00 to our hotel room. Since parking would have been $80.00 for the eight days, this was a good value. We took the hotel shuttle to the airport and it picked us up and brought us back to the to The Marriott on our return. The hotel was immaculate. The room was quiet and well appointed. A sports bar is attached to the hotel and it was a good place to go for a casual dinner. We didn't use the pool or gym but did check them out and they both looked great.

Reviews.Title: “Check out the pool!”
Reviews.Author: agb_abq
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night after touring DC so we could catch an early SWA flight out from BWI. The hotel is nice, the rooms are clean and well appointed. There's a decent seafood restaurant in the lobby (didn't try) and a large sports bar as well (we did try that one - fine bar food, and open late as well - that's a plus.) Wi-fi in the room was fast and solid, just need a password from the front desk. Bring a swimsuit - the indoor pool has a waterfall and a jacuzzi, as well as a lifeguard on duty, which I have not seen very often. Shuttle service several times an hour to the airport. Shuttle can pick you up at the airport as well (downstairs at baggage claim/arrivals, outside door #15)

Reviews.Title: “Just an ok airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: getmarshall
Reviews.Content: Needed to stay close to BWI due to an early flight and chose the Marriott. Arrived late and departed early, so I didn't get a full chance to experience the hotel. Lobby was very nice and modern. The Champions bar was hoping on a wed night, but I was too tired to go in. Room was very dated and I was right next to the elevator so not ideal. The bed was to soft and not comfortable. I also had difficulty getting my tv to work so I gave up and went to sleep. The bathroom was very dated. For the price I paid, hotel was very overpriced for the quality of the accomidation.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk customer service?”
Reviews.Author: FlyMom10
Reviews.Content: The room card states "walk in like you own the place" too bad we weren't treated that way. We called from airport and after given wrong info, waiting 45 minutes we then couldnt get on the shuttle because it was full. The desk manager didn't care and acted like we just misunderstood. Our arrival was exhausting and irritating. Rode the elevator to 3rd floor and hallway was dirty with laundry ( see picture). Where are the maids? Room was very nice and big flat screen tv. Bed looks wonderful! Too bad the front dest was a let-down

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but not much else to praise”
Reviews.Author: richmond787
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small and hallways are noisy. Parking was tough to find on the night we stayed. The front desk staff was going through the motions but seemed indifferent to our patronage. We tried to catch the free shuttle to the airport but it picks up folks from other Marriotts and was therefore full (and unable to accommodate us) two times in a row so we had to take a taxi instead.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel and great front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Sharvi67
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised. Hotel has been updated a bit and my room was clean and comfortable. Front desk and lobby bar staff are great. A hop and a skip from the airport- which makes those early morning departures much more bearable. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “New lobby and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: govgilly
Reviews.Content: They have really put some money in this place since the last time I stayed here. I was just in for a quick night before an early flight. It met all my needs. I was impressed with the new cool lobby.

Reviews.Title: “No safes, no fridges, no return!”
Reviews.Author: RichardS404
Reviews.Content: Nothing else stands out for me. Tha facility is reasonably well-maintained, the staff is a bit tired and clearly not crazy happy to be working there (yes, we can tell), and the two lapses in my title simply take over my experience here. Won't return.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok.... Just ok”
Reviews.Author: je1058
Reviews.Content: We got a room that cearly wasn't cleaned before we got it. Good thing we were only staying to leave first thing in the morning. We complained to the management and they took care of us. I'd give it another try tho... Usually Marriotts are VERY NICE!

Reviews.Title: “Very close to airport”
Reviews.Author: Motadean
Reviews.Content: This is a great location if you need to access BWI. Very nice property there is a resturant onsite.

Reviews.Title: “Very "run of the mill" and needs updating.”
Reviews.Author: bossguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for a 2 day forum. The overall experience was OK but the decor was dated. We never left the property for the 2 days we were there so every meal was provided by the hotel. The food was OK but very typical for hotel meeting fare. I wouldn't reccomend this property for a vacation but i don't believe it is focused on that business anyway. It wasn;t bad, nothing specific to point out, but it did not have any wow factor either. As I mentioned before the decor needs updating as it feels like something from the 1990's. The staff was adequate but not as customer focused as I have experienced at other Marriott properties. In the end it was a pretty typical airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, loved the Chesapeake Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: LuvsLaJolla
Reviews.Content: I am staying in this hotel as I write. We were in town for a football game at Annapolis - it was homecoming and all the hotels there were booked. So we chose the Marriott at BWI as the closest hotel we could find. The exterior looks old, but the lobby area and public spaces are very modern, and the rooms are spacious. We had dinner in the Chesapeake Restaurant last night, and it was really good. We had just flown in from California and did not have the energy to go out of the hotel. I had the crab cakes and the crab soup. The crab soup was a bit pasty, but lots of great crab meat in it. The crab cakes rivaled the best I have ever had - huge chunks of lump crab meat, and very little filling. Superb! I tru to eat crab in every meal when I am in Maryland, and this was the best I got. The bar was particularly well stocked as well. We will definitely stay here again Would definitely go there again. The concierge club is not open for breakfast on Saturday and Sunday - some Marriotts will offer breakfast in the restaurant if you qualify for the concierge club and it is closed; this one does not.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, convenient”
Reviews.Author: carolynyg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very convenient to airport and car rental location with plenty of parking. Room nicely appointed and very comfortable bed. Nice pool (with lifeguard!) My only small gripe is that it's not very clear that the self-serve continental breakfast is not complimentary. The attendant told me many people make that mistake, so why not improve the signage? And also, if it's not free, they really need to get a toaster that actually toasts the bread! But like I said, this is a small complaint. Overall I was pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute decision...”
Reviews.Author: lcb513
Reviews.Content: Made the reservation thru Priceline that day and was very happy with the outcome. We arrived late evening and went right to our room. Had a choice of a king size bed or 2 queens. It was very clean and comfortable. We were not disappointed. It was only 5 minutes from BWI. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: Bizztravel
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott Platinum member, and have stayed here several times when I go in/out of the Baltimore airport. Compared to other Marriott hotels it has not had a full modernization. Older style desk, cabinetry, and bathroom, but nice bed and flat screen TV. The Champion's restaurant downstairs was packed for Monday night football. I had the crab encrusted rock fish at the hotel restaurant one time, and it was excellent. I have also eaten at Maiwand Kabab a couple of blocks away and recommend that. I like this hotel for its convenience to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is Nice, Chesapeake Restaurant inside hotel terrible”
Reviews.Author: mr.gringo
Reviews.Content: Don't get trapped into eating at the hotel. The food is extremely expensive and tastes like it was just defrosted from school cafeteria leftovers. The service was pretty bad. Half the people at the table next to me refused to eat their steaks because they were cooked wrong or rubbery. I know it is convenient but take a cab or your rental car somewhere else nearby. You will be sorry if you eat at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Here for a wedding - standard airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: CyndiMom
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and modern. It was a good choice for an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just Par”
Reviews.Author: PhosphorBronze
Reviews.Content: We were here for a convention. Not a bad place at all. The rooms were clean although the beds were not so comfy (I'm finicky about beds). The dinner they served during the Saturday evening formal event was basic but good. The pool was OK and the kids enjoyed it. The Champions Sports Bar was a little dead and the food a bit tasteless. The girl at the Starbucks bar was friendly. The conscierge had a helpful attitude but was not very knowledgeable. Nothing fancy but it lives up to Marriott standards.

Reviews.Title: “For one night, it was fine”
Reviews.Author: JiL2000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the BWI Airport Marriott recently to avoid a long early morning drive for a flight, and to spend some time together. The hotel was very nice and the staff was friendly. We had no problem getting the type of room we requested, then again it did not seem to be a busy time. The room (king bed) was roomy and very comfortable. We ate in the Chesapeake restaurant in the hotel for dinner. It is on the pricier side but the wait staff was friendly and willing to accommodate our requests. There is also a Champions restaurant which has lower prices and more standard/casual fair. For breakfast the best option for a budget was actually a Bob Evans which is just a mile or so away. It is a very short drive to the airport from the hotel. While we cannot stay how it is if one had to stay a week, overall we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Restaurant and Sports Bar in the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dc1152
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a wonderful restaurant and Sports Bar attached. You don't need to step out for meals. Do try their Crab cakes.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a good cleaning...”
Reviews.Author: vtbrooklyn
Reviews.Content: Not my favorite Marriott. While the gym is nice for a hotel and the parking is free, the room was not so clean. There was makeup smudged on the phone receiver and left over soap in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Callista02
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at Baltimore for an annual convention. When we decided to stay at the hotel, it was for the convinience of it but the service we got from the hotel was least expected. I was blown away by the wonderful services of the staff. The room was exceptionally clean. We got a replenishment of chocolate every evening (my best part) What liked the least was that I could hear noices croming from rooms next door but that not withstanding, I will stay in this hotel any other time I will visit Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated”
Reviews.Author: BaronFoer
Reviews.Content: Very nice renovation. Has great pool and workout room. Location excellent for airport and easy to get to DC or Baltimore from here. Very limited dining in the the immediate area, however the hotel has a realatively nice dining area.

Reviews.Title: “Standard airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: otsthedog
Reviews.Content: Obviously the hotel mainly services BWI. It's standard. No free internet. Staff is friendly. Gym located in lower level. The hotel has two restaurants and a lobby bar that serves Starbucks. Champions restaurant is a sports bar serving American food. There's also a seafood restaurant. Free, unsecured parking in the front lot. Room is fine - triple sheeting and many pillows. Small desk with very limited work surface and it's high and has a chair that won't adjust high enough.

Reviews.Title: “Bites on my Feet”
Reviews.Author: Kirstinjoy1204
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 days, work had a conference and I never left the hotel. First night was fine, checked in late and went to my conference at 8:00am the next day. Went to the the meetings and then the awards dinner, food was not great. I hope my company did not pay much for the food. Choice was NY strip, Stuffed Chicken and Fettuccine Alfredo- out of 150 people I did not here one compliment, steak was thin and beef jerky would of tasted better. Best was when they ran out of Corn Chowder (that they served for lunch as well ) and gave Crab Chowder. I belong to Marriott timeshare and am even from Ogden Utah home of the Marriott, always a quality brand! First time I have ever been bitten by I do not know what. I never left the hotel and woke up with at least 20-30- little bites on feet and face, I showed the desk clerk the marks and told her the room number- that she should check it our room 521. She smiled and said thank you. I never complain, but now that I am home, red from itching and had to leave my luggage outside and sanitize all clothes, I'm a little freaked out! I am traveling again, will support Marriott but will check for bed begs my next check in. I will say the conference center staff was attentive and great......but I am still a little freaked out..............

Reviews.Title: “Denied room”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreReviewer
Reviews.Content: I am a platinum member and have stayed at this hotel almost every week for the past two years. I had a reservation for Monday for two nights but could not change it on line at 4PM. Why?? So when I arrived the following day (tuesday) I was told there were no rooms available. The nice person at the desk checked with her supervisor and no deal. They were sold out. So much for my loyalty to Marriott. I found a room at the Westin and glad of it. I didn't realize what I was missing. What a fabulous hotel in comparison with an excellent restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to BWI, park-n-fly is great”
Reviews.Author: luf2travel
Reviews.Content: I used my Marriott reward points to stay at this property before a trip out of the country. Because I didn't pay for the room, I arranged to park my car there during the trip. During the reservation, I was told it was $30 up to 7 days; upon check-in, I was told it was $5 day which worked out to only $25 for my 5-day trip so that was good. Plus, no tax on the parking so it was much cheaper than the long-term at the airport or even off-site parking. The lobby at the hotel was very nice, you could tell it had just been re-done. The staff was nice, I didn't have much interaction as we spent less than 10 hours at the hotel. The room was clean, could use an update as the curtains and carpet seemed older (still clean though, don't get me wrong-just out of style). The bed, as with all Marriotts, was beyond comfy and I slept so well. The airport shuttle semeed to run every 20 minutes and the Marriott was the last stop (pickups at other Marriott properties such as Courtyards in the area) which means the shuttle could be a little full. The shuttle ride to the airport was about 8 minutes, very easy. Upon our return, we waited about 15 minutes for the shuttle which wasn't too bad. Overall, great location and clean hotel-served it's purpose very, very well.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel - but not so great food”
Reviews.Author: eigenstein
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel to go to a conference in; the rooms are clean and well kept. As usual with a full serve Marriott, the staff work hard to convince you what an upper class hotel you are staying at. The lobby and bar area were very nice, as well. The food at the restaurant (not the sports bar) was poor, not once but twice. The "loaded steak salad" was strips of steak on a bed of iceberg lettuce, a few tomatoes and way too much dressing. The rib eye must have come from a really fat cow. The walnut salad, however, was quite good. The locale is rather sterile; it's an area with a few restaurants and a dozen plus different hotels. You need to spend $30 if you want to get into downtown Baltimore, which is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott is Missing The Mark - Poor Quality Hotel/Hugely Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: ATLTravelsALot
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money. The hotel is located in an area where all BWI airport hotels are situation - along one road. So many other choces - this old awful Marriott will be a Days Inn one day most likely. You walk into a new lobby environment - obvious attempt by the hotel to refurbish the image, but its like walking into styrofoam - that bland. The you hit the rooms and its like walking back in time. Old 1980's style decor with hideous attempts to renovate (Marriott is famous now for throwing on their new worldwide bedding with the nasty gold throw on the end of the bed). Drilled hole in the TV cabinet to make room for the new useless AV module. Same old tub with paint peeling off the ceiling in the bathroom and the walls are so thin I could hear the person in the room next door coughing, talking, and snoring at night! Doors are old metal doors that remind me of stepping back in a time when Marriotts used to cater to upscale business travelors. The food in the restuarant that is supposed to be Maryland style cooking (crab cakes, Maryland friend chicken, etc.) was prepared Asian style - tempura type batter on the Maryland Chicken with greasy Asian style vegtables. Just horrible. The huge restuarant only had 3 people eating there at 7:00 PM on a weeknight - this should have been a sign. I've spent over 450 nights in Marriotts during my career and lately they are just going downhill and missing the mark for 2011 properties in a major way. Something is wrong with this chain. It's a shame - corporate needs to learn that the standard Marriott burger that used to be a consistent request among guests just no longer applies - their attempt to remodel in a half-way manner but putting the same tacky red lamps in every room worldwide is also missing the mark. Oh, and forget about the price I paid of $269 per night for this property - almost embarrassed to admit I paid that. Anyway, bottom line - don't stay here. Finally, the "Stayonline" internet is practically dial-up speed. Kept knocking me off and after work when people returned to the hotel the internet speed was terrible - impossible just to check email at times. Again, a sign of the times when you have to register with some 3rd party lowcost ISP - so frustrating. Oh - I keep thinking of other nuisances - while the promote the Executive Lounge, it is locked most of the time. Walk in and it is also old and rundown - downright nasty in there - reminds me of eating in a college cafeteria.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, relaxing environment.”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreBetty
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the BWI Marriott 3 times. Each time the staff has been attentive and they happily go above and beyond. The beds are super comfy. The walls are soundproof. I get a good night's rest here everytime. Free parking, free shuttle to and from airport, free internet and printer in the Business Center. The food venues are great. I tried the Champions Sports Bar and the food was very good, with Bryan being an excellent server.

Reviews.Title: “Loud and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: nicblue78
Reviews.Content: Based on appearance, the BWI Marriott is a wonderful hotel. The lobby and rooms are updated and nicely decorated. However, I barely slept the first night of my stay. The walls were so thin I could hear almost everything the people in the room next to me said (and did). There was an event at the hotel and people were walking up and down the hall laughing and talking until 2am. The privacy lock on my door wasn't working. The bed was uncomfortable, and there were hairs on the bathroom floor and in the bathtub. Positives about the hotel: Hotel is conveniently located, the HD TV was large, the pillows were extremely comfortable, having a refrigerator in the room was convenient, the business center was nice, and the Starbucks coffee shop was wonderful. However, based on the overall value, I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: oz1972
Reviews.Content: The room was quiet, beds very comfortable - and best of all, no duvets. Sheets and blankets were greatly appreciated. Buffet breakfast was good, though the placement of the serving tables caused a bottleneck at the waffle making machine. We had dinner twice at the hotel restaurant - good experience both times. The music provided by the piano player on a Saturday night was very enjoyable. Staff was always helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “The Importance Of Service”
Reviews.Author: Silver007_10
Reviews.Content: Friends and family rates are not welcomed at Marriott hotels; this became obvious when calling around to get prices for rooms. Custumer service goes out the window if you have friends and family rate. The reservations department was very rude, offensive and condescending. It was obvious that Marriott doesn’t train their staff on the importance of customer service. I am a Leasing Professional for a very large Management company, and we have a lot of people relocating due to jobs and or family related issues and sometimes they will need a temporary place to stay maybe for a night or two while everything is being processed clears and based on the service I receive today I will not be recommending the Marriott to anyone. It seems as though as soon as I asked for the friends and family rate it was as thought the whole tone of the conversation changed, as far as they knew I could have been a friend of the GM but I do not think that crossed their minds. I am leading my portfolio, and I am very aware of the importance of customer service, it’s all about service, networking and referrals and Marriott reservation department do not have a clue. I would suggest Marriott to listen more often to the recorded calls, and then maybe offer training were it is needed, and it is very much needed. Here it is there probably making pennies on a dollar ,and your judging me because I am asking if the friends and family rate is being offered at certain time, and the ironic thing is if they didn’t receive an employee discount ,they themselves would not be able to afford to stay there. Pointer for Marriott reservations department, you never know who you’re talking with, be very selective with your words, as well as the tone of your voice.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Marriott for business travel”
Reviews.Author: super66shazbot
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with staff that knows how to serve business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: ziggyziggy
Reviews.Content: The fiancee and I travel to baltimore all the time and we try to book a different hotel each time. This time we booked the BWI Marriott using marriott points. The hotel normally books for $129 on the friday we arrived. First of all parking is free so thats good since we drove. Upon entering the lobby, we were very impressed. The lady at the front desk informed us it was renovated a few months ago. Everything was brand new and very beautiful. The wall behind the front desk even changes color every minute!!! The business center has a few super cool looking computers for internet usage. The pool was located behind a glass wall and it was impressive from far away because it has a waterfall but the pool is quite small. Also it does not appear the pool has been renovated along with the lobby but we didnt use the pool so it doesnt matter to us. The rooms are very standard and the amenities are Bath & Body Works. The towels are clean and white. The counters and bathroom surfaces are spotless, and I mean SPOTLESS!! Alas, the last thing to mention was the bed. We arrived at 10pm just to sleep and wake up right in time to check out. I have not had such a great sleep in a while. We both fell asleep without knowing with the lights still on. the linens were soft and luxrious. We felt rejuvenated in the morning and ready to go shopping and to eat the famous crabcakes maryland has to offer. The bedsheets were clean, SPOTLESS, and very top quality, We both could not compliment the beds enough. If quality of sleep is important, do not hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, oustanding service!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler82560
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night. The hotel is close to the airport. The lightrail ($3.20 r/t) or a cab fare ($30 oneway) will get you into the inner harbor. We took the lightrail into the harbor. And a taxi back to the hotel. It's nice staying in the inner harbor hotels but they are so expensive. I would recommend staying here and saving a few pennies. Well worth it. Hotel was very clean, and the staff outstanding!!!

Reviews.Title: “Smokers Fouled the Air in Front of the Lobby”
Reviews.Author: lordsakana
Reviews.Content: At a nonsmoking hotel, I was dismayed to walk through a cloud of filth in front of the lobby as smokers lit up there. Surely this is not a designated smoking area. Construction was going on inside so perhaps these were uninformed construction workers. Unfortunately, housekeeping knocked on our door repeatedly even with the privacy on, effectively ruining our stay. The waterfall above the pool is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “If you want good service, stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: travel-bug313
Reviews.Content: Hotel was under construction, and this of course happens, but failure to accomodate guests, lack or service, rude interaction, dirty rooms, and did I mention rude staff...is unacceptable. Would I stay here again, no. Would I reccomend this hotel to anyone, no. Marriott has some house cleaning to do in BWI!

Reviews.Title: “Location & staff are great but cleanliness is another story...”
Reviews.Author: FlaGardenGirl
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was helpful, courteous, and effcient and the location for an early morning departure from BWI was great. Our room, unfortunately, had stained upholstery, a torn sheet, and hair on the bathroom floor. Ugh.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: bienemy
Reviews.Content: Needed to stay close to the BWI airport for a business trip. Check in was very nice and I was given a room on the 9th floor, which gave me access to the Elite Club lounge or whatever its called. They had free drinks there and other stuff. In the morning they had a nice breakfast in the special lounge. They have a sports bar in the hotel, but I decided to walk up to the Chili's that was just up the street. The fitness room was very nice. The internet was good and the lady at the front desk told me that she would give me the internet for free rather than have to pay. I would figure that if I'm staying on an Elite club floor that I should get the internet for free. The staff was friendly. Nothing special and it was a very comfortable stay. Very close to the airport. I thought the price was a little high, but with the included breakfast and proximity to the airport, it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Responsive staff. Good dining experiences. Convenient to BWI.”
Reviews.Author: travelisphun
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over the weekend of 10/17/2009 - 10/19/2009 prior to our return trip home to Florida. Hotel facilities are older and could use upgrading such as replacing in wall heating and cooling units with central units.. But we found everything was in operating order. Most importantly we found the staff to be very accommodating and responsive. A problem we reported with bedding was followed later that evening by a call from the desk staff to make sure the problem was properly addressed and she was eager to do whatever was necessary to make our stay 100% satisfactory. We stayed on the concierge level and found both the staff and the food offered in the lounge morning and evening to be excellent. We also ate two meals in the main restaurant and found the food and service to be of the highest quality.. In addition I noticed a sign in the lobby stating that management is available weekday mornings in the lobby to meet guests. I didn't go but I felt that was a nice touch. This is a good facility if you wish to be close to the airport. I would visit this hotel again if the opportunity presents itself.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and old”
Reviews.Author: CentralNJTraveler
Reviews.Content: The fan is noisy and the A/C when it kicks on would wake anyone. It's a very old hotel that needs to be renovated. Breakfast buffet was very skimpy on fresh fruit and other items.

Reviews.Title: “Not Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: IADbound
Reviews.Content: Sitting in BWI’s strange land of endless hotels amongst industrial buildings west of the airport, this hotel is lacking in almost everything except (of course) location. The facility is old. Check-in was courteous, but slow. Common areas were dimly lit. Room door handles have to go UP to open the door. Furniture in sitting area of suite was of a ridiculously cheap quality. Television in bedroom did not work. Trash from previous guest found in can. With the number of choices around the airport (and right next door), you can do much better.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service at nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SU1975
Reviews.Content: Received large amounts of attitude from hotel management and front desk staff after complaining about hotel's shuttle bus service. Had to call four times and wait an hour for shuttle pick-up. Hotel staff messed up re: reservation as well. Had my party staying for just one night when two nights were booked and paid for in advance. Also, the hotel website makes no mention of it but be aware the hotel pool is closed until 5PM during the week. So if you and/or your kids like to swim this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - Accomodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: BeekCt
Reviews.Content: So easy. From parking to check-in to room service and more, everything here was easy and well done. We were able to relax immediately upon arrival as the check-in was done in about 2 minutes. The shuttle was great - a nice free ride to the light rail to head downtown. Staff were outstanding - very friendly and responsive. Room service food was pretty good - free meals for kids under 5. When one of orders was incorrect, it was promptly replaced in less than 15 minutes. The beds were very comfortable. Check out was also a breeze and took less than 2 minutes. Wi-Fi should be free throughout the hotel - I believe the charge was about $12.95 per 24 hour period. FYI - you can get free wi-fi in the public areas and in rooms sometimes on the guest network. Overall great stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Airport Marriott BWI is Fly”
Reviews.Author: tpapi
Reviews.Content: My wife and son stayed here for one night prior to an afternoon departure to Fort Lauderdale from Baltimore. We were very happy with our stay and felt the property offered a bit more than your standard aiport hotel. BWI Airport Marriott is located in Linthicum Heights, a suburb of Baltimore. It's a fairly quiet area and the shuttle is only about a five-minute ride to any of the terminals. It runs every half hour after 5 a.m. throughout the day and into the evening. They have a great pool with a waterfall and jacuzzi. There is also a lifeguard on duty who was consistenly doing his job and kept the area safe and clean. Champions Sports Bar is attached to the hotel and offers some great casual dining at a reasonable price. It's a great place to watch a game, grab dinner or get a drink. The area around the property is safe and you have some other nice dining options such as Ruby Tuesday or Bob Evans. The staff were very courteous and accomodating. After parking my car on property they could have charged $50 but the attendant at the front desk only asked for $15 which was a really nice gesture. My room was clean and it was a fairly nice size. It was nothing out of the ordinary but was comfortable. There is a small kiosk near the hotel entrance where you can print boarding passes. It's very convenient. Lastly, the fitness center was nice and had some fairly nice equipment so you can grab a workout complete with free towels and water. I secured a rate of $70 for the night using Priceline which was virtual steal as the rack rate on the Marriott site was $170 at the time of booking. If you go on Priceline and bid on a 3.5 star at the BWI Airport there is a better than average chance of being placed at the Marriott or the Embassy Suites. Both are solid choices. We would be happy to stay again and would recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “A very good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Consultant2468
Reviews.Content: Airport hotels know they have a locked-up audience and built in market. This one does not take advantage of that fact. They have great service and their rooms are fairly decent. Good staff service, friendly, and clean. Very convenient to the airport without being there.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: cjl10schic
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Marriot-BWI this past weekend for a wedding. The rate, although a bit high, was around the range of prices the other Baltimore hotels were offering. Being a marriot, you can always expect these hotels to be clean and accomodating. The room itself (king bed) was beautifully made and felt luxurious. The bed was comfy and the other furniture was nice as well. This hotel has a sports bar attatched to it, so if you want to have a few drinks, you only have to go downstairs. We did not get a chance to use the pool, but it looked nice (as well as the hot tub). The hotel also has flight information displayed in the lobby and available on the hotel network, which is good for anyone flying in or out of the nearby airport. Overall, I would stay here again if I was flying into BWI. If I wanted to do more in the city, I may be tempted to stay in downtown somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Marriot BWI - not children friendly”
Reviews.Author: LeonetteS
Reviews.Content: For a high end hotel, this hotel did not even offer a continental breakfast. We had real problem with the pool area. While we were there for a family reunion, with young children, there were individuals down at the pool area that were posing in pornograhic poses and one of the women had a bathing suit on with the back cut half way down her behind so that when she bent over it was extremely indescent - it was more exposing than a thong bathing suit. We asked the hotel security to ask them to cover up and stop the posing - but security refused to do anything. We then asked for a manager and the manager stated that they could not do anything about it. I informed them that a bathing suit like that would be illegal on the beaches in Maryland and I was informed that since it was a private pool they did not have to follow the laws. I would question ever staying in a hotel like this with children

Reviews.Title: “great Priceline deal”
Reviews.Author: loveguru
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for $40 on Priceline. Needed somewhere to stay after a late night flight, before driving to Ocean City. Staff seemed nice... Nothing special, typical Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel nice but problem with employee...”
Reviews.Author: momof4inmd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one evening prior to flying out for a 4 day vacation. Chose this hotel because of close proximity to BWI airport. Hotel itself is nice and we had no problem checking in. We liked the fact that we could pay $5 a day to park while we were gone and just catch a shuttle for free to and from the airport. Our disappointment came when we arrived back from vacation and found that our car battery was dead, We went to the front desk to ask for assistance and received a very condescending comment as well as no help at all from an employee named Anthony. Another employee, however, did take over, named David, and was able to get someone in their maintenance area to assist us with a jump so that we wouldn't have to use our roadside assistance and wait for help.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff at the BWI Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Gelfi
Reviews.Content: Staff cold and unfriendly. Did not make me feel welcome at all, particularly the front desk supervisor, David, upon checking in. I have stayed at the Marriott Courtyard down the street in the past, and the staff there goes out of their way to be helpful. I can not say the same for this "3-star" full service Marriott that we stayed in this time. The price was good for this place, but I'm sure we only got it because the hotel is in deperate need of a renovation. The room was nice enough, and the bed was comfortable, which I guess makes up for the unfriendly staff. Passed one Marriott employee in the hallway who did not say hello or ask how my stay is. The only reason this place was acceptable was because we got it on priceline for $65/night or something.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: travelcat1
Reviews.Content: We decided to have a get-away vacation to Baltimore, MD. We chose to go when the NY Yankees were in town to play the Orioles. Because of this game- the hotels in the harbor raise their prices and sell out months in advance. We would have to pay approx $300- $400 a night in the harbor and we were not looking at spending that kind of money. So we booked the room here. The room itself was clean and perfect. They had a shuttle bus that ran often to the airport. From the airport you could take the light rail to the harbor. Approx 25 min ride. It was perfect. We were able to experience everything we wanted to do without having to park in the harbor. Would recommend this for those that dont mind traveling a little bit to the harbor. I thought the price was perfect for what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Realxing for a night”
Reviews.Author: Wise_One
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night andwould give it 3.5 stars. It was comfortable, staff was Ok, it was nothing special but bette rthan the comfort inn for sure. If you need a place by the airport for early morning flight I suggest you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent For Business Travelers & Other Events”
Reviews.Author: nem
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is a great hotel for business travelers, conferences, wedding receptions, and other events. However, I will not reccommend it for families with children due to the small (NYC size) rooms. I was there recently at a business conference. The hotel food and banquet halls were great. Hotel Pros are: Great dining Fairly clean rooms Complimemtary Shuttle bus to and from the airport Easy access to the highway, Arundel Mills Malls, and other dining Free room service menu for children under the age of 5 Room service prices were reasonable Free parking Cons are: The carpet in the rooms were not that clean, because my socks were black from walking without shoes. Small rooms Not for families- my toddler had no space to play Hotel restaurant prices are a little pricey I highly recommend this hotel for business travelers and for those who are having events only.

Reviews.Title: “Want to shower? Or a nonsmoking room? Go elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: mjp3md
Reviews.Content: When I checked in, I was given a smoking room. The desk clerk insisted that is what I had requested when I made my reservation. Being 7 months pregnant and having never smoked in my life, I highly doubt that. I insisted upon a non-smoking room, and he finally found one - the furthest from the elevator at the end of a long hallway. Good times when you're as pregnant as I am! The TV didn't work, but they replaced it for me a day later. My friend was in a room for 3 days with a non-working shower. The front desk never offered to move her, and in fact suggested that she use the shower in the gym! The manager offered her a free coffee at Starbucks to make up for her troubles. Ridiculous. I have stayed at this hotel before, and was much more impressed then. The customer service, particularly at the front desk, needs a lot of work.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ricci_N_Max
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a Wedding in early June. This was a beautiful hotel. A truly classy room with a very comfortable bed, great pool area, fun bar, friendly staff. Absolutely no complaints. Also, great access to BWI Airport and the Interstate.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a family at BWI Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: Jimmaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and were very happy with the hotel. The check-in was flawless, the front desk helpful and the room was very nice! We loved the new beds and linens that Marriott recently changed. The location was very good for getting to the Inner Harbor. We drove and it is only about 10-12 minutes down the road, very easy to do for non-residents. The pool and whirlpool was very nice and they even had a lifeguard! we would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, no real problems”
Reviews.Author: hobber6
Reviews.Content: Nothing real fancy but very comfortable. What I expected for $119, includign being overrun by Bosox fans. A couple miles from the terminal and light rail. Not a whole lot in the immediate area for restaurants, other than a McD Bob Evans and Ruby Tues. but the huge mall is a few miles away. Very nice lobby and bar area. Very comfortable king bed, wife loved the bathroom and the shampoos and lotions they offered. Champions pub downstairs is a great place for a few beers, watch the game or shoot a game of stick. The hotel shuttle was great, the driver friendly and helpful to and from the light rail. The manager went out of his way to ask about our stay and doesnt seem like he puts up with too much nonsense so I'd check w/ him if you have any trouble. If the kind of thing bothers you the only minor problem was unfriendly clerk checking in and another while trying to cash a travelers check. I would definately stay here again. Any questions shoot me an email

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong here”
Reviews.Author: Chiefy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a quick weekend in Baltimore for a trip to Camden Yards and an Orioles Game. We arrived at BWI at approximately 6:45pm on Saturday, and were in the shuttle on the way to the hotel by 7:10pm (no checked luggage), arriving at the hotel in less than 10 minutes. Check in was flawless, the room clean, bright, and comfortable. We used the shuttle several times back and forth to the light rail station (public transportation) and the drivers were all very pleasant, especially Jay, who went out of his way to answer any questions we had. Very happy with the overall experience. The hotel was everything you would expect, the Champions Restaurant in the lobby was great, and overall was a great few days. We even booked through Priceline, got a great deal (50% off quoted rate). Would have liked to have stayed longer. Can't go wrong at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but long wait for shuttle”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was very pleased with this hotel, although we were only there for a quick overnight. The only down side was the shuttle from the airport. We landed around 9:40PM, had only carry on luggage, walked to the courtesy phone and called. They told us to stand at the second curb and wave down the bus. What a nightmare! There are cars, rental car busses, park and fly busses and hotel busses, all trying for the same "curb" Admittedly, there did seem to be an awful lot of traffic! The bus finally came by and we were able to flag it down. After picking us up it stopped a little further down and ended up picking up the flight crew that was on our plane. Then it headed to the hotel, but stopped at the Fairfield first, (where the flight crew got off) then drove to the MArriot. All in all, we left the gate at 9:40 and it was 10:30 before we were at the desk checking in. I might have been willing to pay $5 for a cab had I known how long it was going to take. (and the cab's you could catch at the "first" curb, much less crowded) A big plus was that there's a Champions Restaurant there which was open serving food and drink until 12:30. My daughter was starved so this was great as it saved us a room service bill. She wants to go back to use the pool, It looked great!

Reviews.Title: “Recently Renovated”
Reviews.Author: Sofarsogood
Reviews.Content: We (3 familes) did a park & fly deal there in February 2005 before heading to Cancun. I was a little concerned after reading the reviews here, but we were very happy. The hotel appeared to be recently renovated and the rooms were beautiful. The shuttle service to the airport at 4 AM worked out fine, although we had trouble coming back because the shuttle was full by the time it reached us at the international terminal. We spent the evening before our flight by the pool so the kids could swim. The pool and hot tubs were very nice. There were tables by the pool so we brought in carry-out and coolers and had a grand time. Thinking this may be a nice place to get away for a weekend next Feb if we don't do Cancun again!

Reviews.Title: “Now updated”
Reviews.Author: SalemTraveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night weekend stay at the BWI Marriott on a priceline bid of $50 per night plus fees or about $60 per night. It was well worth it. Last November for the same priceline bid I stayed at the BWI Amerisuites and it was NOT worth it. At checkin I showed my Marriott Rewards card and asked for an upper floor room with king bed. I was given room 815. Though it didn't have much of a view, the room was nicely decorated and super clean. Sound proofing was amazing even with little children in nearby rooms. The fitness center and pool are great and the lobby is an eye catcher. Shuttle service to BWI is efficent and on time. The only glitch was on my final night guests received notice that all water would be turned off from midnight until 5 am for emergency repairs. Since I needed to catch a 5 am shuttle to the airport, I called guest services and asked what I should do about showering, shaving, brushing teeth and using the toilet between 4 am and 5am. The guest services person couldn't think of anything. Using my old boy scout training, I was able to figure out a way but was dissapointed that guest services hadn't anticipated this situation.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Airport Corporate Meeting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a standard Marriott Hotel at an airport location, meaning nothing special, but not bad. A five minute or less ride from the terminals, it is very convenient, although the Baltimore airport (BWI) has been undergoing renovation for ever with no end in sight and the congestion at the shuttle van area is the worst I've seen at any airport in the world. I'd advise calling the hotel to assure that the shuttle will be on the lookout for you. Once you've arrived, staff are very friendly and helpful. Rooms are corporate Marriott, a bit worn as at most airport hotels, but clean and completely functional. Standard restaurant, meeting rooms, etc. Great for business, early AM flight departures or late PM arrivals, but not for vacations, family trips, or romantic getaways.

Reviews.Title: “Non-smoker”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Made reservations for a non-smoking room, yet when checked in they gave me a smoking room. I bitterly complained with to no avail. The front desk said they would send someone up to spray, yet after hour half no response. Went to the front desk, and they called someone up. They gave the room three or four squirts, and an ionizer that didn't blow any air. I woke up in the morning with the taste of smoke in my mouth. The front desk said the reservation just reserves the room, and not a non-smoking room that I requested. She said next time, you have to reserve a non-smoking room. I told her the management, that is what I thought I did. The food was very high priced with no salad or soup with the dinner. The bread was hard. Last comment: Worst Hotel that I stayed in my whole life.

HotelInfo.Name: BWI Airport Marriott
HotelInfo.Address: 1743 West Nursery Road, Baltimore, MD 21240
